As an elected official, I am grateful for the women who have exercised their right to vote and feel blessed to represent you.

24 years before women got the right to vote, Martha Hughes Cannon became the 1st female state senator in the U.S. She advocated for women’s rights based on equality arguing that “one of the principal reasons why women should vote is that all men & women are created free & equal.”

Emmeline B. Wells fought for women’s suffrage in Utah many years before the passage of the 19th amendment. Her persistence and conviction in the movement led to the inclusion of a female suffrage clause in the Utah Constitution in 1896. #suffragesisters

Today I wear a yellow rose to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the 19th Amendment passing the House, guaranteeing women the right to vote. I am proud that Utah women were among the first to pave the way for the women’s suffrage movement in the U.S.  #WomensVote100 pic.twitter.com/vNj9LIe2DA

Today I cosponsored the TRACED Act. This bill will help put an end to the annoying & infuriating #Robocalls we all get everyday. It requires call verification, gives the FCC more time to fine violators, & increases the penalties to $10,000. Thank you @RepDavidKistoff for leading!

The Rabbi Michoel Ber Weissmandl Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2019 (H.R. 929) recognizes Rabbi Weissmandl for his acts of valor during WWII. His bravery helped save hundreds of lives.

We’ve seen an alarming increase in the amount of hateful attacks against the Jewish community this past year. In an effort to educate the nation about heroes of the Holocaust, who rose up against hate and anti-semitism, I have cosponsored H.R. 929.

Before the first #TranscontinentalRailroad, it took months to travel from coast to coast. The railroad dramatically decreased travel time into days. The sudden ease of transporting products and people made the U.S. an economic powerhouse. #Spike150

#OnThisDay we celebrate the 150th anniversary of the completion of the first #TranscontinentalRailroad.  This significant event not only transformed travel entirely, but is a perfect example of what man's ingenuity can accomplish. #Spike150 https://twitter.com/USNatArchives/status/1126542872105377792 …
